io.github.ddimitrov.nuggets

Class UrlStreamHandlers

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.ddimitrov.nuggets.UrlStreamHandlers

  • public final class UrlStreamHandlers
extends Object

    URL schema handlers - a quick way to add support for data URLs and Classpath URLs to your project.

    The official URLStreamHandlerFactory extension API has a number of drawbacks, the most significant of which that there can only be one.

    An alternative, suggested way is to keep using the default implementation (Launcher.Factory) and just plant your Handler classes in a package following the default convention sun.net.www.protocol.<schema>.

    For example, to add support for data URLs and cp URLs under the schemas cp:com/foobar/MyResource.txt, add the following 2 files:

    • File: <src-root>/sun/net/www/protocol/data/Handler.java 
      
 package sun.net.www.protocol.data;      // the schema is the last part of the package
 public class Handler extends DataUrl {} // the class name needs to be Handler
    • File: <src-root>/sun/net/www/protocol/cp/Handler.java 
      
 package sun.net.www.protocol.cp;
 public class Handler extends UrlStreamHandlers.ResolversUrl {
    public Handler() { super(Foobar.class.getClassLoader::getResource, ClassLoader::getSystemResource); }
 }

    With this setup you don't need to set any system properties or muck with factories. Also, this way all protocols shipped with the JRE will keep working.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  UrlStreamHandlers.DataUrl
      An URL stream handler that adds support for data URLs.
      static class  UrlStreamHandlers.ResolversUrl
      An URL stream handler that resolves to another URL schema - use this to build custom URL schemas that can shorten URIs or lookup resources.
      static class  UrlStreamHandlers.ResolvingUrl
      An URL stream handler that resolves to another URL schema - use this to build custom URL schemas that can shorten URIs or lookup resources.

    • Method Detail

      • createDataUrl

        public static String createDataUrl(@Nullable
                                   @Nullable String mediaType,
                                   String data)
        Factory method for URL-encoded data-URLs from a string. These have the advantages that they are more readable when few special characters are used.
        Parameters:
        mediaType - the optional MIME type for the resource (pass null if you don't care)
        data - the resource that should be encoded by the URL.
        Returns:
        an URL that would yield data when resolved.

      • createDataUrlBase64

        public static String createDataUrlBase64(@Nullable
                                         @Nullable String mediaType,
                                         byte[] data)
        Factory method for Base64-encoded data-URLs from a string. These have the advantages that they are more compact when representing binary data.
        Parameters:
        mediaType - the optional MIME type for the resource (pass null if you don't care)
        data - the resource that should be encoded by the URL.
        Returns:
        an URL that would yield data when resolved.
